page.title: 11NEW HALL BOREHAM 1
page.content: New Hall was one of 6 manors of Boreham Parish granted in 1062 by Harold to the Dean and Secular Canons of the college he founded at Waltham. In 1350 the Canons had to exchange New Hall for manors near to Waltham Abbey. It was eventually aquired by Henry V111 th. from Sir Thomas Boleyn. Henry beautified the place and called it Beaulieu, but local people continued to call it New Hall, and in later years New Hall once again became the accepted name.Henry placed his arms over the Gate House and these can be seen today in The Chapel. Later Elizabeth 1st. granted the house to Thomas Radcliffe 3rd. Earl of Sussex. New Hall was badly damaged during World War 2, but restoration has been skilful, and New Hall is a beautiful house today.
